title: Matua 2014 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: Simple but well made, this medium-bodied, supple wine features plenty of tart cherry fruit and a crisp finish.

title: Millbrook 2014 Merlot (New York)
description: Plusher and rounder than the Special Reserve bottling, Millbrook's standard label Merlot suggests soft red-cherry flavor accented with cocoa powder, savory mushroom and beetroot. Gentle acidity and fine-grained tannins accentuate its plump juicy feel. Drink now through 2019.

title: La Togata 2014  Rosso di Montalcino
description: Aromas of cured meat, violet and grilled herb waft out of the glass. The rather diluted palate offers wild cherry, game and a salty note alongside fleeting tannins and zesty acidity.

title: Raymond 2013 District Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: There's a bittersweet tartness to the tannin profile within this wine that is otherwise dusted in cedar, dried herb and black currant. With a big, full-bodied presence of oak, it shows ripe and robust fruit character and plenty of bite.

title: Uccelliera 2014  Rosso di Montalcino
description: Aromas of underbrush, Mediterranean scrub and moist earth lead the nose. The lean palate offers unripe sour cherry, dried sage and a hint of orange peel alongside bracing acidity and tightly wound tannins.

title: The Loop 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc lacks the depth and concetration of top examples, but remains a tasy glass of crushed tomato leaf and white grapefruit. Gentle greens and modest citrus flavors end clean and refreshing.

title: Rémy-Pannier 2014  Chinon
description: This is a pleasant, fruity rendition of Cabernet Franc. With its perfumed black fruits, light tannins and crisp acidity, it is easy to drink. Try chilling this wine slightly for best effect.

title: William Hill Estate 2014 Merlot (Central Coast)
description: Dried plum, dried strawberry and dried raspberry meet with cola spice on the fresh if thin nose of this bottling. The palate offers sour plums, peppercorns, damp compost and smoke flavors.

title: Vini 2015 Veni Vidi Vici Pinot Noir (Danube River Plains)
description: Aromas of brown baking spices and black cherry open the bouquet of this wine. There are soft tannins with flavors of red cherry, black cherry and cherry cola in the smooth and round finish.

title: Wedell Cellars 2014 Rose of Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Made from free-run juice, this offers aromas of dried cherries, dessicated watermelon and clove. Plummy fruits and sour cherry show on the palate.

title: Suhru 2014 Dry Riesling (New York)
description: Bramble and dusty mineral notes extend from nose to finish in this dry Riesling, lending a savory tone to freshly pressed apple and dried orange peel flavors. Its voluminous, mouth-filling texture is pleasant, balanced neatly by a strike of lemonade acidity.

title: Zinsane 2014 Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This relatively light wine smells and tastes like strawberries and raspberries. It has good balance and a straightforward texture.

title: Threesome Cellars 2012 Coombsville Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Meant to reflect the three elements of terroir, nature and man, this small-production wine is well represented in compost, dried herb, mild tannin and oak. The acidity is moderate and in some ways disjointed, while the finish features highlights of vanilla and currant.

title: Bougrier 2015 V Grande Réserve Vieilles Vignes  (Vouvray)
description: This is a medium-sweet wine, full of honey and lemon flavors. A rich character balances sweetness with apple fruit and acidity. It's ready to drink.

title: Boyle MacDonald 2012 Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)
description: This big, bold wine offers lots of fruit flavor, firm tannins and a full body. Ripe berries flood the palate, while a gripping texture makes it feel tight on the finish.

title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The aromas of herb, kiwi and citrus are quite light. The tropical flavors are elegant and spritely, tingling the palate with a light effervescence.

title: Clos Alivu 2015 Rosé (Patrimonio)
description: Produced from Niellucciu, this wine is ripe, perfumed and also packed with crisp acidity. Fresh raspberry, citrus and a touch of caramel are brought comfortably together by the acidity and zesty aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Columbia Crest 2015 H3 Sauvignon Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: Quite light herb and citrus aromas are followed by elegantly styled citrus and tropical flavors. It needs more oomph to bring it together, coming off as a bit generic.

title: Damiani 2014 Bollicini Sparkling (Finger Lakes)
description: Dusty crushed mineral and pressed apple notes lend a rustic tone to this softly effervescent sparkling blend. Stark lemon-lime acidity frazzles the midpalate but leads a brisk, refreshing finish. Drink now through 2018.

title: Dante Robere 2014 Love Ranch Vineyard Mourvèdre (Madera)
description: Aged in new French oak for 17 months, this wine tilts heavily toward wood flavors. It has toasted oak aromas plus rich and almost sweet fruit and chocolate flavors accented by black pepper and smoked bacon. Very oaky, it has a tannic texture and smoky finish.

title: Cave de Saumur 2014 Les Petites Roches  (Saumur Puy-Notre-Dame)
description: From the plateau south of Saumur, this wine is full of stalky Cabernet Franc. Along with spice, fruitcake flavor and blackberries, it has a slight vegetal overtone. The wine is made to be drunk young, possibly lightly chilled.

title: Château de Crézancy 2015 Rosé (Sancerre)
description: This lively, fruity wine is crisp with acidity, orange-zest flavors and red-currant fruitiness. It is dry, lightly mineral, juicy and bright at the end. Drink now.

title: Antucura 2014 Tani Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Vista Flores)
description: Herbal, almost herbaceous aromas of foxy berry fruits and wet dog get this Cab Franc off to a shaky start. A chunky, blocky, tannic mouthfeel and leafy herbal flavors of plum and berry fruits finish with little change. Without doubt this tastes and smells like the grape variety.

title: Aresti 2016 Special Release Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)
description: Green herbal aromas suggest an untamed field. This is snappy and tangy but dilute, thus there's a watery element to salty citrus and bell-pepper flavors that are maintained on the finish.

title: Atwater 2014 North Block Six Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)
description: Ruddy ripe black cherry and plum flavors are intensified by notes of coconut, vanilla and baking spice in this plush Cabernet Franc. Full bodied and supple in mouthfeel, it's framed softly by sunny acidity and fine feathery tannins. It's approachable and straightforward but pleasantly juicy.

title: Ben Ish 2015 Ben's Select Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Powerful, dark syrupy flavors and strong salt and pepper spices vie for attention in this full-bodied wine. It has heady fruit aromas, savory, spicy accents and a lingering finish.

title: Black Cabra 2015 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Aromas of blackberry and prune are earthy, warm and cheesy. This feels heavy and syrupy but not out of whack. Roasted, blackened flavors of grapy berry fruits finish with mint, clove and peppery notes.

title: Black's Station 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Yolo County)
description: Smoky, toasty oak forms an obvious part of this full-bodied wine's personality, from the first whiff to the spicy, cedary flavors and on to the finish. Moderate tannins add texture.

title: Larchago 2015 Viura (Rioja)
description: Light and mostly fresh up front, this is a wine to drink now. Regular apple and citrus flavors are simple and easy, with zero complexity. This is an average everyday white with no clear faults but not much character either.

title: Domaine Gueguen 2015  Saint-Bris
description: The wine comes from the only appellation in Burgundy to grow Sauvignon Blanc, located not far from Chablis. This is classic herbal Sauvignon that is light and fruity with tangerine and citrus flavors and a tropical fruit hint. Drink now.
